name: pointing device production, optical mouse, with cable | pointing device, optical mouse, with cable | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/442/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 unit of optical mouse with cable. It is based on typical optical computer mouse used at home or in an office examined at the EMPA laboratories, a Logitech Optical Mouse USB manufactured in 2002 with a total weight 0.120 kg.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of raw materials and auxiliares at the factory gate.

This dataset includes  materials (mainly metals and plastics) with  manufacturing processes (e.g. the rolling of the supporting steel plate or the injection moulding of the plastic and rubber for cover, base and wheel). Infrastructure, electricity for the assembly are included as well. The water consumption during production has not been taken into account due to lack of information.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/262:Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment/2620:Manufacture of computers and peripheral equipment

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is based on weighing measurement at the EMPA Laboratories in 2006. The optical mouse looked at is available all over the world. Therefore a global dataset is justifiable.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The production of an optical mouse includes the sheet rolling of the steel plate plus the injection moulding of the plastic and rubber parts (cover, base and wheel). An optical mouse is constructed with components like LED (light emitting diode), sensor, clips, lens, small printed wiring board and base plate.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Own measurements at laboratory (weighing) and manufacturer information.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Modern surface-independent optical mice work by using an optoelectronic sensor to take successive pictures of the surface o which the mouse operates. Most of these mice use LEDs to illuminate the surface that is being tracked; LED optical mice are often mislabelled as "laser mice". Changes between one frame and the next are processed by the image processing part of the chip and translated into movement on the two axes using an optical flow estimation algorithm. (Wikipedia, 2007)
